definition: cleaning or other products used in or on ovens that do not fit in a more refined category
cleaning or care products specific to metals, which do not fit into a more refined category
Cleaning or care products for laundry and fabric treatment which do not fit into a more refined category
anti-static sprays for fabrics (spray formulation assumed)
Includes urinal cakes and screens for use in urinals, also includes deodorizers used in portable toilets
Cleaning solutions specifically for jewelry products
products that remove grease, oil, and other hydrophobic  materials from hands, includes waterless products
cleaning products for general household cleaning, which do not fit into a more refined category
products used to clean hard surfaces in the home, including kitchen specific hard surface cleaners
products poured down, or placed in, drains to control odors or clear blockages that work by chemical or biological processes
products for deicing surfaces, including ice/snow melt

Article components that are used as parts in the manufacturing of other products, including hardware (such as nuts, bolts, screws, etc.) or seals (such as gaskets, o-rings, etc.), that do not fit into a more refined PUC.
Clothing and personal protective equipment used in medical settings to minimize exposure to workplace hazards (e.g. scrubs, face masks, gowns, gloves);

Medical and dental supplies and equipment, e.g. medical equipment used in a hospital or doctor's office setting, at home (e.g. wheelchairs), Excludes medical testing supplies. See Medical PPE for clothing and personal protective equipment used in medical settings (e.g. scrubs, face masks, gowns, gloves); See Personal Care - Ostomy products for ostomy related products used in home settings.
Consumer products related to personal safety
Other consumer products that do not fit into more common categories
Pepper sprays for personal self-defense
Materials that are fired, scattered, dropped or detonated from guns, including ammunition and components such as shell casing, a bullet, gun powder, and primer.
Clothing and accessories likely to have direct contact with the user. Includes jackets, hats, shoes, etc.

Misc. consumer goods likely to have direct contact with the user (e.g. sports equipment, hand-held non-electric tools, jewelry, clothing, jackets, bags/luggage/purses, and other apparel, blankets and sheets, newspapers, adult diapers, feminine hygiene products, pencils and writing implements
products used to polish metal surfaces
products used to remove lime or scale from hard surfaces excludes dishwasher related products
products applied to carpets to remove or mask odors
carpet-cleaning products that may be used directly (or require dilution), includes solutions that may be used by hand or in mechanical carpet cleaners
products related to cleaning or care of bathrooms, which do not fit into a more refined category
home air fresheners, including fragranced candles and incense
bathtub, tile, and toilet surface cleaners

genCat: Cons. electronics, mech. appliances, and machinery
definition: Products used to convert electricity into light, consisting of a source of illumination (e.g. an electric filament or one or more LEDs) enclosed within a transparent or translucent shell.

genCat: Cons. electronics, mech. appliances, and machinery
definition: Including small and large consumer electronics appliances (e.g. refrigerator, washing machine, vacuum cleaner, computer, phone, smoke detector, electric tools, lamps); includes small electronics with direct personal contact such as massagers; excludes electronics specifically intended for use by children; excludes electronics with direct food contact (e.g. electric blender)
Products used by professionals in the construction of roadways.
Fabric treatments or dyes which can not be assigned to a more refined category
paints or sealers for treating fabrics
products placed on the skin for decorative purposes (body paints, markers, play cosmetics, Halloween cosmetics, and products such as henna)
inks used for permanent tattoos
products used to create textured or fiber covered surfaces, including artificial snow
multi-component crafting kits where individual products are not designated
arts and crafts supplies which can not be assigned to a more refined category
home office supplies which can not be assigned to a more refined category
products related to pottery making which can not be assigned to a more refined category
General arts and crafts or office supplies which can not be classified into a more refined category.
Misc. consumer goods likely to have indirect contact with the user (e.g. home decor (paintings, decorations), lampshades)
Vehicles beyond standard road vehicles for passengers and goods (e.g. planes, trains, boats, *not* cars, trucks, vans); also including mass transit vehicles
Packaging that does not come into contact with food, e.g. boxes, cloth packaging, phone covers, bubble wrap, packing tape.
deodorants and antiperspirants
teeth whitening products (excluding toothpastes)
general personal care products which do not fit into a more refined category
products for spot-treating acne, including creams, lotions, wipes and pads

facial cleansing products (excluding scrubs), for acne treatment

Sprays, varnishes, resins, etc. intended for coating and insulating electrical and electronic products.
Fluids used to cure (vulcanize) rubber components for enhanced strength and durability, especially as used repairing rubber products, such as tires.
Formulations used as part of a process, or in a piece of equipment (e.g. lubricants, adhesives, oils)

Products used in an industrial setting as blast media for a variety of purposes, including: paint stripping, coatings removal, pressure blasting, powder coating, deflashing, deburring, surface preparation and mold cleaning.
products used on wooden surfaces, including decks, to impart transparent or semitransparent color
paints applied to hard surfaces that are intended to be painted over and that improve adhesion, coverage, or prevent the bleeding through of stains

Treatments for skin infections that are not otherwise specified. Excludes antifungal or antibacterial skin treatments.
products for priming eyes for makeup
hair colors, dyes and washes intended for beard and mustache facial hair
Personal Care products intended for use on the body, that do not fall into more specific categories.
Products intended for infant dental care, including: toothpaste, tooth gel, tooth wipes, etc.

Products intended to  stops or slow down the growth of microorganisms, primarily used to reduce the risk of infection. Antiseptic substances inhibit the growth and reproduction of many microorganisms, including bacteria, fungi, protozoa, and viruses. Intended for general antiseptic products that do not fit into  more specific categories such as antibacterial or antifungal skin treatments.

Products that form a protective coating on the skin designed to protect vulnerable areas  from the effects of 1) mechanical or chemical injury and 2) excessive moisture from incontinence, perspiration or wound drainage. Products include petroleum jelly, skin sealants and balms, etc.
Oral care products intended to remove bad breath. Products include sprays, breath strips, etc. Does not include mints or other ingested food products.
Products intended for care and grooming of facial hair, such as beard conditioner, oils, creams, etc.

wax crayons for coloring or illustration

oils and other liquids that are used to cool and/or lubricate metal workpieces when they are being machined, ground, milled, etc. Includes Cutting Fluids used for cooling and lubricating cutting tools, and Stamping fluids used for the forming of metal into shapes.

fluids used as heat carriers in the refrigeration cycle for repeated phase transitions from gas to liquid, primarily used in air conditioners and refrigerators/freezers
Products that prevent materials from adhering to each other, or bonding to surfaces/ manufacturing molds.

Over-the-counter (OTC) drugs that are available to consumers without a prescription. Includes products that are taken primarily by oral route. Examples include acetaminophen, aspirin, antacids, decongestants, antihistamines, and laxatives.

products added to clothes washers or dryers to scent clothing and other fabrics
products used in washing machines to clean fabrics
products used to improve tactile properties of fabrics that are added to the rinse water of clothes washers  (excluding dryer sheets)
products used to release wrinkles or to impart stain resistance to fabric
fabric deodorizers
dryer fabric softener sheets
dry cleaning fluids or kits for home use
lighters, lighter fluids, and other indoor fuels
products used for houseplants (fertilizers, pesticides, and leaf cleaners) and cut flowers (preservatives and desiccants)
heavy duty hard surface cleaning products that may require dilution prior to use (i.e., may  be concentrated)
General use batteries that do not fit into a more refined category.
Electronic device batteries that do not fit into more refined categories. Includes replacement batteries for these devices.
Single-use alkaline batteries, used in general household products (AA, AAA,  etc).
Batteries for general use that are specified as rechargeable.
Electronic device batteries intended for wireless/cordless telephones, including cell phones. Includes replacement batteries for these devices.
Electronic device batteries intended for laptop computers. Includes replacement batteries for these devices.
Electronic device batteries intended for cameras, including photo and video cameras. Includes replacement batteries for these devices.
Products used to clean hard surfaces in commercial/industrial settings. Including surface and glass combination products.
products used to control viruses, bacteria, etc. on hard surfaces in commercial/industrial settings. Includes disinfectant sprays, wipes, etc.
Antibacterial products for application to hands intended for commercial/industrial settings. Includes sprays, gels, wipes, etc.
pet shampoos (including those containing pesticides, such as flea/tick shampoos)
pesticides orally administered, worn (e.g. collars), or applied to the skin, fur, etc. of pets; including flea/tick collars, excluding pesticidal shampoos
miscellaneous aquarium products for the maintenance of aquatic pets
miscellaneous pet treatments (excluding pesticides and shampoos)
products for pet care which do not fit into a more refined category; specifically those products which can be used on all pets
products intended for pet care and general animal care, which do not fit into a more refined category
products intended for the care of farm animals, including cows, horses, pigs, chickens, etc.
care products specifically for pet fish, fish ponds, etc, which do not fit into a more refined category
solids used to capture and deodorize cat wastes
care products specifically for cats which do not fit into a more refined category
